creator: maggiedot@gmail.com
text:
I found a wrongly written charactor in the JMeter v2.2 in Chinese(Simplified) 
version. When I adding a HTTP Request to a Thread Group, I found the 
translation of the first checkbox(Redirect Automatically) typed "×Ô¶¯´Ó¶¨Ïò"£¬
but actually it should be "×Ô¶¯ÖØ¶¨Ïò". For more evidence, you can see the 
picture captured from my computer in the URL: http://wantdownload.my-
php.net/php/bug.jpg, hope this can help JMeter becomes better.

Thanks.

Yours 
                                                     Tang Liang

The entry in messages_zh_CN.properties is:

follow_redirects_auto=\u81EA\u52A8\u4ECE\u5B9A\u5411

can advise what it should be instead?
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> The entry in messages_zh_CN.properties is:
> follow_redirects_auto=\u81EA\u52A8\u4ECE\u5B9A\u5411
> can advise what it should be instead?

OK, the var define should be like this:
follow_redirects_auto=\u81ea\u52a8\u91cd\u5b9a\u5411
creator: maggiedot@gmail.com
maggiedot@gmail.com
text:
In the menu "File", the "Exit" link has a wrong chinese charactor 
translation, it should not be using the charactor "\u63a8\u51fa" but 
the "\u9000\u51fa".


Thanks.

Yours

                                                         Tang Liang

(In reply to comment #2)
> (In reply to comment #1)
> > The entry in messages_zh_CN.properties is:
> > follow_redirects_auto=\u81EA\u52A8\u4ECE\u5B9A\u5411
> > can advise what it should be instead?
> OK, the var define should be like this:
> follow_redirects_auto=\u81ea\u52a8\u91cd\u5b9a\u5411

Thanks, added to SVN
creator: sebb@apache.org
sebb@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #3)
>   In the menu "File", the "Exit" link has a wrong chinese charactor 
> translation, it should not be using the charactor "\u63a8\u51fa" but 
> the "\u9000\u51fa".
> Thanks.
> Yours
>                                                          Tang Liang

Thanks, but this was already reported in Bug 40419 and has been fixed.
